title: Could The Yardbirds be the most underrated rock band? - Quora

response.answer_text: They did not have a HUGE pop presence- of 5 studio albums, only one hit the top 20, and between the US and UK, only 5 singles in the top 10- the most successful in the US being ‘For Your Love’, which was their most pop release. (three UK singles made it to #3). But think about the words ‘pop release’. The captivating magic of the Yardbirds post-Clapton music was the awesome diversity in music styles past ‘pop’- between Beck and Page, we had ‘Rave Up’ Psychedelia, Gregorian chant, Indian sitars/middle east scales, spacey music, harp-driven electric blues, acoustic guitar solos, and genuine hard core rock with outstanding lead guitar work throughout. For some reason, the public wasn’t buying into this creativity, such a shame. I personally found their pre-Page mixes to sound thin and weak, diminishing the power of these tracks. When Jimmy took over, he used his session work experience to make their sound HEAVY- and as we all know, a precursor the the Led Zep sound. But maybe they peaked too early to catch the transition of pop music into serious statements, and folk stopped listening. Yep, I’d agree, the record buying folk seriously underrated these guys. I won’t quibble about the qualifier ‘MOST’ underrated, though.

I like the Yardbirds a lot, they had some great songs. Unfortunately, not unlike John Mayall’s Bluesbreakers, they seemed to fulfil the role of finishing school for three of the best guitarists of their generation: Jeff Beck, Eric Clapton and Jimmy Page. The combined subsequent success of all three somewhat eclipsed that of their former vehicle. That doesn’t take away from the Yardbird’s achievements, it’s just that they are better remembered for hosting the talents of three superstars. While remaining, without doubt, the template for Led Zeppelin.

I love the Yardbirds-well,when they were doing pop music or pop blues-more accurately-but pop was so dominated by the BEATLES,SEARCHERS,HOLLIES etc. and the fact that they evolved into led zep( yuk) left them not so much underrated as swallowed up by the jimmy page/plant mania. but every fan that digs back is rewarded in spades. History has,however, SEVERELY underrated the HEARTBREAKERS L.A.M.F. LP. if i were a teen now and googled them-i would feel really cheated and pissed that i didn’t know about them.i would nominate them as most underrated!
